intro: Caralluma peschii, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom at night. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent structure and deep root system. Caralluma peschii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
